intro: Machaerina australis, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a species native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feathery fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can live for several decades, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its roots form a symbiotic relationship with mycorrhizal fungi, aiding in nutrient absorption. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
